abstract.text: An object that contains event attribution information for Web AdAttributionKit.

legalNotices.copyright: Copyright © 2025 Apple Inc. All rights reserved.

inlineContent.text: Apps use event attribution objects to send data to the browser when opening an external website that supports Web AdAttributionKit (formerly known as Private Click Measurement, or PCM). For more information on the proposed PCM web standard, see
Mac apps built with Mac Catalyst don’t support Web AdAttributionKit.
In order to use Web AdAttributionKit, your app defines an

that contains the URL to which the browser sends event attribution data. When an externally linked website reports that a conversion has occurred, the browser forwards your app’s event attribution data to the endpoint specified in the
doesn’t contain this key, the browser won’t be able to forward the Web AdAttributionKit data when a conversion occurs.
Send event attribution data to the browser only when your app opens an external link as a result of a user tapping a control that sits below a

in the app’s view hierarchy. The event attribution view verifies that the user tapped a control. If that control doesn’t sit below an event attribution view, the system won’t send the Web AdAttributionKit data to the browser when opening the external link.

inlineContent.text: object, send it to the browser when your app opens a URL as the result of a user tap. If the external website reports a conversion within 7 days, the browser forwards the data from the
object to the specified remote server sometime between 24 and 48 hours after the conversion.
There are two different ways to send event attribution data when your app opens an external link, depending on whether your app uses
for life cycle management. For more information on application life cycle management, see

The browser, and not your app, sends the event attribution data to the remote server. If the user’s selected browser doesn’t support Web AdAttributionKit, the event attribution fails even if the external website reports a conversion.

abstract.text: The URL where Private Click Measurement and SKAdNetwork send attribution information.
An object that provides a visible standard interface for browsing the web.
A configuration object that defines how a Safari view controller should be initialized.
An object you use to send tap event attribution data to the browser for Private Click Measurement.
Construct and manage a graphical, event-driven user interface for your iOS, iPadOS, or tvOS app.
The centralized point of control and coordination for apps running in iOS.
An object you use to send tap event attribution data to the browser for Private Click Measurement.
Attempts to asynchronously open the resource at the specified URL.
An object that contains event attribution information for Web AdAttributionKit.
The destination URL to attribute.
Initializes a new event attribution object.
The entity that purchased the ad or content.
The URL that receives attribution data.
A string describing the source tapped to launch the external link.
A number that identifies the source of the attribution.
An overlay view that verifies user interaction for Web AdAttributionKit.
An object that represents one instance of your app’s user interface.
Options you specify when asking a scene to open a URL.
Attempts to open the resource at the specified URL asynchronously.
Respond to system notifications when your app is in the foreground or background, and handle other significant system-related events.
The root class of most Objective-C class hierarchies, from which subclasses inherit a basic interface to the runtime system and the ability to behave as Objective-C objects.
A protocol that objects adopt to provide functional copies of themselves.
The group of methods that are fundamental to all Objective-C objects.
A type that can be hashed into a `Hasher` to produce an integer hash value.
A type that can be compared for value equality.
A singleton actor whose executor is equivalent to the main dispatch queue.
A type with a customized textual representation.
A type with a customized textual representation suitable for debugging purposes.
A type whose instances can be encoded, and appropriately passed, as elements of a C `va_list`.
A thread-safe type whose values can be shared across arbitrary concurrent contexts without introducing a risk of data races.
